title: Beyond the Genetics of Addiction
descriptions:
**Title:** Beyond the Genetics of Addiction: A Comprehensive Investigation of Substance Use and Health Relationships

**Abstract:**

This grant proposal outlines a cutting-edge research project, 'Beyond the Genetics of Addiction', designed to unravel the complex interplay of genetic and environmental factors contributing to substance use disorders. The study focuses on four frequently consumed substances: nicotine, alcohol, cannabis, and caffeine. Leveraging the strengths of extended twin family designs, DNA-variant data, RNA data, and biomarkers analysis, this project aims to identify and confirm genes and gene networks associated with substance use.

Utilizing the Netherlands Twin Register as a sample source, this longitudinal study will investigate the relationship between substance use and health outcomes. The proposed research involves the collection of biological samples and longitudinal phenotype data from a large sample size. The researcher team, with extensive experience in data collection, coordination, data analysis, behavior genetics, and addiction research, will employ state-of-the-art analysis methods to explore gene expression patterns and investigate biomarkers.

By confirming the existence of genetic and environmental factors contributing to substance use disorders and identifying associated genes and gene networks, this project will provide critical insights into the complex relationships between substance use and health outcomes. The research will have significant implications for the development of targeted prevention and intervention strategies for substance use disorders, ultimately contributing to improved public health.
